question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Compute
\[\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)}.\]
inference:
Solution:
We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{18 \cdot \frac{19}{2} \cdot \frac{20}{3} \dotsm \frac{36}{19}}{20 \cdot \frac{21}{2} \cdot \frac{22}{3} \dotsm \frac{36}{17}} \\
&= \frac{18 \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \dotsm 36}{20 \cdot 21 \cdot 22 \dotsm 36} \cdot \frac{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 17}{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 19} \\
&= \frac{18 \cdot 19}{20 \cdot 21} \cdot \frac{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 17}{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 19} \\
&= \frac{18 \cdot 19}{20 \cdot 21} \cdot \frac{1}{18 \cdot 19} \\
&= \boxed{\frac{1}{210}}.
\end{align*}Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{1}{210}}$. I hope it is correct.

question:
Solution:
We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{18 \cdot \frac{19}{2} \cdot \frac{20}{3} \dotsm \frac{36}{19}}{20 \cdot \frac{21}{2} \cdot \frac{22}{3} \dotsm \frac{36}{17}} \\
&= \frac{18 \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \dotsm 36}{20 \cdot 21 \cdot 22 \dotsm 36} \cdot \frac{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 17}{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 19} \\
&= \frac{18 \cdot 19}{20 \cdot 21} \cdot \frac{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 17}{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 19} \\
&= \frac{18 \cdot 19}{20 \cdot 21} \cdot \frac{1}{18 \cdot 19} \\
&= \boxed{\frac{1}{210}}.
\end{align*}Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{1}{210}}$. I hope it is correct.

inference:
The given expression is a telescoping product. Notice that most of the terms cancel out. We can rewrite the expression as follows:

\begin{align*}
&\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} \\
&= \frac{18 \cdot \frac{19}{2} \cdot \frac{20}{3} \dotsm \frac{36}{19}}{20 \cdot \frac{21}{2} \cdot \frac{22}{3} \dotsm \frac{36}{17}} \\
&= \frac{18 \cdot 19}{20 \cdot 21} \cdot \frac{20 \cdot 21 \cdot 22 \dotsm 36}{20 \cdot 21 \cdot 22 \dotsm 36} \cdot \frac{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 17}{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 19} \\
&= \frac{18 \cdot 19}{20 \cdot 21} \cdot \frac{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 17}{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4 \dotsm 19} \\
&= \frac{18 \cdot 19}{20 \cdot 21} \cdot \frac{1}{18 \cdot 19} \\
&= \boxed{\frac{1}{210}}.
\end{align*}
